item.title: Pennsylvania election results may take days to count. And, ACLU fighting Louisiana law
item.description: As results roll in on election night, Pennsylvania's may take a while longer. Here's why that is. And, the ACLU challenges Louisiana's Ten Commandments law saying it harms children.

item.title: What your mammogram can tell you about your cardiovascular health

item.title: Peru’s ex-president Toledo gets more than 20 years in prison in case linked to corruption scandal
item.description: Peru’s former President Alejandro Toledo was sentenced to 20 years and six months in prison in a case involving construction giant Odebrecht that became synonymous with corruption in Latin America.

item.title: Akron to pay $4.8 million to Jayland Walker's family over police shooting
item.description: The family of Jayland Walker, a Black man who was fatally shot by eight police officers, will receive a $4.8 million settlement from the city of Akron, the mayor's office said.
